intro: Selkirkia triananum, commonly known as the Triangular Selkirkia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
